faqs.question: How to prep for field notes?
faqs.answer: Bring a notebook, timestamp observations, separate description from interpretation.

faqs.question: When is the site report due?
faqs.answer: See the assignments schedule; site reports are due Sunday 11:59pm of the assigned week.

faqs.question: Can I work with a partner?
faqs.answer: Partner work is allowed only when specified; otherwise individual submissions are required.

faqs.question: What materials do I bring to digs?
faqs.answer: Closed-toe shoes, notebook, pencils, measuring tape, and gloves; see gear checklist.

faqs.question: How long should reflections be?
faqs.answer: Aim for 400â€“500 words with one cited course reading.

faqs.question: How are artifacts cataloged?
faqs.answer: Follow the catalog template; include provenience, description, material, and condition.

faqs.question: Late policy for site visits?
faqs.answer: Arrive on time; late arrivals may forfeit participation credit for the session.

faqs.question: Is there extra credit?
faqs.answer: No standing extra credit; occasional optional activities may be announced.

faqs.question: Where to upload photos?
faqs.answer: Upload to the LMS 'Field Photos' folder with location and date metadata.

faqs.question: How to cite field interviews?
faqs.answer: Use pseudonyms, include interview date/time, and follow the ethics handout.

faqs.question: Are drones allowed on sites?
faqs.answer: Drone use requires prior approval; follow the policy in the syllabus.

faqs.question: What is expected in lab sessions?
faqs.answer: Complete the lab worksheet and photo-document your steps; submit within 24 hours.

faqs.question: How to handle fragile artifacts?
faqs.answer: Use gloves, support from below, and place items on padded trays only.

faqs.question: Where is the map of the dig site?
faqs.answer: See the 'Site Maps' folder in LMS; week-specific maps are posted each Monday.

faqs.question: How is field safety handled?
faqs.answer: Safety briefing in Week 1 and daily tailgate talks; follow the checklist posted in LMS.
